column1: Heloísa Eneida Paes Pinto Mendes Pinheiro (born July 7
column3: better known as Helô Pinheiro (Portuguese pronunciation: [eˈlo piˈɲejɾu])
column4: is a Brazilian former model and businessperson.

column2: Pinheiro became the source of inspiration for the song "The Girl from Ipanema" when songwriters Antônio Carlos Jobim and Vinicius de Moraes saw her walking to the beach in Ipanema
column3: her native neighborhood in Rio de Janeiro..

column1: Pinheiro became a Brazilian Playboy Playmate in 1987 and once again in 2003
column2: when she did a pictorial along with her daughter

column1: She also appeared in the second season of The Amazing Race
column2: for the Beach portion of the first Detour clue
column3: and on America's Next Top Model
column5: for a modelling challenge in Brazil.

column2: the song's copyright owners (the heirs of the composers) sued Pinheiro for using the title of the song "Garota de Ipanema" as the name of her boutique. In their complaint
column3: they stated that her status as the inspiration for the song did not entitle her to use the title of the song commercially.

column1: Public support was strongly in favor of Pinheiro. A press release by the composers
column3: that named Pinheiro as the original "girl from Ipanema" ("garota de Ipanema") was cited as evidence that they had intended to bestow this title on her. The court ruled in favor of Pinheiro.
